member.name: T:Arx.Core.Exceptions.ErrorNumbers
member.summary: Contains error number constants.
member.remarks: Error numbers from 2000 to 4999 are warnings. The operation that raised a warning can be retried without changes. Error numbers from 5000 to 7999 are errors. The operation that raised an error may work if arguments are changed. Error numbers from 8000 to 9999 are critical. If a critical error is raised support may need to be contacted.

member.name: T:Arx.Core.Utilities.DecimalUtilities
member.summary: Methods and extensions for decimal.

member.name: M:Arx.Core.Utilities.DecimalUtilities.ToEbcdicZonedDecimalString(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Converts the decimal to a EBCDIC Zoned Decimal string with 2 implied decimal places.
member.returns: A string representation of the decimal encoded as an EBCDIC Zoned Decimal
member.remarks:
EBCDIC Zoned Decimal format, also known as IBM Numeric replaces the right-most digit with a character that represents the value and the sign of the number. The values for the last character are:
ASCII Character Value ASCII Character Value
{0}-0
A1J-1
B2K-2
C3L-3
D4M-4
E5N-5
F6O-6
G7P-7
H8Q-8
I9R-9

member.name: M:Arx.Core.Utilities.DecimalUtilities.ToMicroFocusZonedDecimalString(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Converts a decimal value to a string in the MicroFocus zoned decimal format with 2 implied decimal places.
member.returns: The decimal value as a string in the MicroFocus zoned decimal format.
member.remarks:
The zoned decimal format used by MicroFocus, MicroSoft, and Fujitsu COBOL compilers use last character to imply the sign of the value. The characters 0 - 9 are used to represent positive values while the characters P - Y are used to represent negative values:
ASCII Character Value ASCII Character Value
00P-0
11Q-1
22R-2
33S-3
44T-4
55U-5
66V-6
77W-7
88X-8
99Y-9

member.name: M:Arx.Core.Utilities.StringUtilities.CheckLuhnsFormula(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applys Luhn's formula to determine if value passes the Luhn's formula checksum.
member.param: Indicates whether or not to ignore the non digit characters within the string. If this value is false an exception will be thrown if the value contains non-digit characters.
member.returns: True if the value passes the Luhn's formula checksum.
member.remarks:
Luhn's formula is used to validate self checking numbers such as Social Insurance Numbers, Social Security Numbers, or Credit Card Numbers. To apply Luhn's formula:
Read the number from right to left.
Every second digit is doubled and then the sum of those digits are added together and added to the checksum. Other digits are added to the checksum without doubling.
Add the value of each digit to the checksum, doubling every second value before it is added.
If the resulting checksum is divisible by 10 then the number is valid.
